back_cards.example_en: The cold wind made her shiver.
His cold response surprised everyone.
The room felt cold and unwelcoming.
She caught a cold after the trip.
He prefers his drinks cold.
The glass in the window was cracked.
She filled her glass with water.
The telescope’s glass was finely crafted.
She checked her reflection in the glass.

back_cards.definition_en: a quantity held by a glass
back_cards.example_en: He ordered a glass of juice.
She worked to improve her grades.
He practiced daily to improve his piano playing.

back_cards.definition_en: to upgrade a system or process
back_cards.example_en: The company improved its website design.
Her health began to improve after rest.

back_cards.definition_en: to increase in quality or value
back_cards.example_en: The updates will improve the product.
The movie is for adults only.
She handles problems like an adult.
Adults can vote in the election.

back_cards.definition_en: a grown-up in a professional setting
back_cards.example_en: The meeting is for adults in the company.
An adult must sign the form.

back_cards.definition_en: the exchange of goods or services
back_cards.example_en: International trade boosts the economy.
He learned the trade of carpentry.
The trade of stocks was profitable.
They made a trade of their comic books.
She works in the fashion trade.
The religious ceremony was peaceful.
She is a deeply religious person.
The school has a religious affiliation.
He followed the rules with religious precision.
The festival included religious rituals.

back_cards.definition_en: the upper part of the body
back_cards.example_en: She wore a hat on her head.
He’s the head of the department.
The head of the table was reserved.
The farm has fifty head of cattle.
Let’s discuss the head of the proposal.
The book received a positive review.
The team held a review of the project.
She did a review before the exam.
His annual review went well.
The movie’s review was in the paper.
What kind of music do you like?
This kind of flower blooms early.
They sell all kinds of snacks.
That kind of car is expensive.
I prefer this kind of coffee.
She wrote her address on the form.
The president gave an address on TV.
Please share your email address.
The package was sent to the wrong address.

back_cards.definition_en: a way to approach an issue
back_cards.example_en: The address of the problem took time.
She joined a writers’ association.
The smell had an association with childhood.
The association sets industry standards.
Their association led to a new project.
The word has a strong association with joy.
She measured the room for new curtains.
They measured the project’s success.
He measured his words carefully.
She measured two cups of flour.
The coach measured the team’s progress.
The store has a large stock of books.
She invested in tech stock.
The soup was made with chicken stock.
He comes from farming stock.
Their stock of food lasted weeks.
He filled the car with gas.

back_cards.definition_en: a substance in a gaseous state
back_cards.example_en: The balloon was filled with helium gas.
The stove runs on natural gas.
The gas caused everyone to evacuate.
They spent hours trading gas about sports.
The lake is very deep in the center.
She felt a deep sadness.
The book explores deep philosophical ideas.
They were deep in the forest.
His voice was deep and soothing.
The lawyer defended her client in court.
She consulted a lawyer about the contract.
The lawyer prepared the will.
The lawyer argued the case confidently.

back_cards.definition_en: a specialist in a legal field
back_cards.example_en: He’s a lawyer who focuses on tax law.
The factory increased its production.
The play’s production was a hit.
The production of the book took years.
Oil production dropped this month.
The TV production won several awards.
She can relate the story to her own life.
I relate to his struggle with stress.
He related the events of the day.
The teacher related the lesson to history.
The two issues relate closely.
The book was open to the middle.
They met in the middle of the bridge.
The shirt was tight around her middle.
We’re in the middle of the project.
The policy benefits the middle class.

back_cards.definition_en: the act of organizing or controlling
back_cards.example_en: Good management led to the team’s success.
Management approved the new budget.
Time management is her strength.
The event’s management was flawless.
His management of the crisis was praised.
